docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The chief Republican sponsor of a House measure to repeal the Medicare Catastrophic Coverage Act said today that he could accept the Senate's scaled-down version of health insurance to cover the cost of major illness.

headline.main: G.O.P. Sponsor of Repealing Plan For Elderly Hints at Compromise

docs.snippet: LEAD: The chief Republican sponsor of a House measure to repeal the Medicare Catastrophic Coverage Act said today that he could accept the Senate's scaled-down version of health insurance to cover the cost of major illness.

byline.original: By MARTIN TOLCHIN, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: As the influenza season nears, doctors are issuing their annual warnings that people at risk of life-threatening complications should get flu shots. But the vaccinations can also be valuable for otherwise healthy people.
docs.snippet: LEAD: As the influenza season nears, doctors are issuing their annual warnings that people at risk of life-threatening complications should get flu shots. But the vaccinations can also be valuable for otherwise healthy people.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: FRUSTRATED by the failure to stop the flood of drugs into the country, leaders of America's battle against drugs are seeking to restrict supplies of key ingredients and processing chemicals required to make illegal substances. But many experts believe the effort is doomed to failure by the seemingly endless alternative methods of synthesizing drugs that technically skilled criminals have devised.

headline.main: Problems Loom in Effort to Control Use of Chemicals for Illicit Drugs

docs.snippet: LEAD: FRUSTRATED by the failure to stop the flood of drugs into the country, leaders of America's battle against drugs are seeking to restrict supplies of key ingredients and processing chemicals required to make illegal substances. But many experts...

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Pressure is building to revise Gramm-Rudman, the budget-balancing legislation enacted in 1985 and amended in 1987. Indeed, Congress seems to be on the verge of adopting a pattern of amending the law every two years. This year the argument for revising the targets will have a new and powerful twist: the need to protect people's retirement checks by segregating the Social Security accounts from the rest of the budget for deficit reduction purposes.
